metadata.title: CVE-2018-15173 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
Nmap through 7.70, when the -sV option is used, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (stack consumption and application crash) via a crafted TCP-based service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-15173` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ncat - 7.80+dfsg1-2build1
ndiff - 7.80+dfsg1-2build1
nmap - 7.80+dfsg1-2build1
nmap-common - 7.80+dfsg1-2build1
No subscription required

notes.note: sbeattie> additional commits may be needed to be pulled from GH#1196

criterions.comment: nmap package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.80+dfsg1-2build1').
